holidays.name: Oatmeal Cookie Day
holidays.description: A delightful celebration dedicated to the chewy, sweet, and sometimes nutty oatmeal cookie! Perfect for those who adore this classic comfort treat.
holidays.origin: While not officially established as a national holiday, this day gained popularity among food lovers and bakers who wanted to honor the humble oatmeal cookie as a delicious snack.
holidays.funFact: Oatmeal cookies were originally created in Scotland and often included raisins or currants, making them a healthier alternative in early recipes.

holidays.name: Johnny Appleseed Day
holidays.description: Honoring the legendary American folk hero Johnny Appleseed, who famously planted apple trees across the United States, spreading apples and stories wherever he went.
holidays.origin: Johnny Appleseed (real name John Chapman) was a nurseryman and missionary in the early 19th century, and March 11 is believed to be his birthday.
holidays.funFact: Johnny Appleseed was not just about apples‚Äîhe was known for his kindness, environmentalism, and eccentric lifestyle, often going barefoot and wearing a tin pot on his head!

holidays.name: World Plumbing Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to recognizing the importance of plumbing in maintaining public health and sanitation around the world. Celebrate your plumber or appreciate your pipes!
holidays.origin: Established in 2010 by the World Plumbing Council to highlight the crucial role plumbing plays in society.
holidays.funFact: Good plumbing is credited with dramatically reducing deadly diseases like cholera and typhoid, making it a silent hero of modern health.
